values:
You are in a mall when the zombies attack. You have:

1. one weapon.

2. one song blasting on the speakers.

3. one famous person to fight alongside you.

Weapon can be real or fictional, you may assume endless ammo if applicable. Person can be real or fictional.

1. In fantasy I'd love a sword, but I'd get tired pretty quick, so in reality a shotgun and with endless ammo, can't think of anyone who would turn THAT down. 

2. The Battle Hymn of the Republic. This is a tougher question than you would think.

3. Boromir from Lord of The Rings, hey we're not killing Orcs, I'm positive he'd survive but if he didn't then Daniel Craig as James Bond, that man really knows how to rock the house!!

You are most like Aragorn. You have strong convictions and you stick to them. Although you are more of a recluse, you are extremely loyal to the few friends that you have. You are very serious about things, but you like having fun. Fame and fortune mean little to you, and you aren't concerned with being popular. Good for you!

What LoTR Character Are You?

<lj-cut text = "Lets see how this looks on paper"> 

What you are about to read is nothing more than free flow thinking. When I set out to write this story, I wanted to create something that would twist the reader in the gut, there are too many stories created for the wrong reason. Rape is wrong, it's the violation of another against their will. Rape is not hot, rape is not sexy, it's not something the victim wanted - EVER. 

So with that in mind I also wanted to write more than just your average rape story, where Legolas gets raped, he cries a bunch, he has healing sex with someone and it's happily ever after. It NEVER works like that in real life. So I want to a rape story as it really is.

<lj-cut text= "I offer no excuses for what you are about to read">DISCLAIMER: NOT MINE

so they never had sex together

Legolas like to be on top
Aragorn liked to be on top
so they both went to the big top together 
THE END

Aragorn was a hottie when he brushed his hair
But one day Legolas lost his pants and Aragorn lost his hair
So they had sex
THE END

Legolas liked the missionary position
Aragorn liked ANY position as long as he was getting laid 
So they had sex but.... it was just OK
THE END

Legolas had a thing for beards
Aragorn had a thing for hobbits
So one day Frodo and Gimli had sex
Legolas and Aragorn killed them, then they had sex
THE END

One day Legolas and Aragorn were arguing
Legolas told Aragorn to "stick it where the sun don't shine"
Aragorn did...but it wasn't the best he'd ever had.
THE END

Legolas's penis was 12 inches long

That's the long and the short of it 
THE END

Legolas liked to dance

So they shagged HORIZONTALLY
THE END

Legolas hated commitment

So they never got committed

So they went down to the corner drugstore and got ice cream 
THE END

so Frodo had Sam bronzed

I think I'm going to kill Legolas and Aragorn
they have more sex than I do

<lj-cut text = "How I know Olie is NOT the cannon police"> Olie is not the cannon police I am postive about this because I have never know the cannon police to ever admit they might be wrong. I have also never known the cannon police to be nice to someone who might sometimes play a bit loose with the details. The cannon police also like to beat people over the head with the heavest copy of LoTR they can find, for daring to disagree with them also, lol. 

I will say these past few days of getting back in touch with my characters are like getting back in touch with myself. I am afraid Mike might have a stroke if I don't finish Brotherhood, lol. Olie was right when she said the journey ends the same for all of us. But these words, the ones I write, the ones Mike sweats over, the ones that Olie hears in her dreams. These words are our legacy to a time we will never see. Years from now someone will happen upon our words and just as JRRT continues to inspire us, even after his death. So our words will inspire someone else to say "what if". Not a bad legacy for someone as myself who leaves no children behind. Chances are I may never meet Mike and Olie in person. Mike whom I love as much as life itself. He has always known what I want to say even when I cannot figure out how to say it. I love when Mike asks me if I have written anything and I can say "yes", he's as excited as any kid at Christmas and I always try to envision his face when he's opening up something to read that I have written. And Olie who has picked through my thoughts in these journal entries pointing out that my reasoning is sound and thereby chipping away at my large list of reasons why this story can't be finished and actually getting me to think maybe it can be done. Mike has always encouraged me it could be finished as well, but until I started sorting my thoughts out here I didn't think it was possible. I sort of worried that no one but Mike or Olie would read it even if I started writing again, but maybe that's ok, I don't need a lot of feedback, but feedback is still nice all the same. I am a member of a couple of groups and no one seems to even notice when I post a story, no one says anything and it makes me feel invisible. I think in some ways even attention by the cannon police would be ok, as it meant someone noticed. 

I like to laugh and I love to tell stories. I see faraway places, Lords and Ladies, castles, talking dragons, heros and villians. Some, like the hobbit Frodo, get caught up in circumstances they never expected. Others, like Aragorn, can only find their true destiny after their resolve and mettle have been tested to the point of death and beyond. Then there is Boromir, out of all the characters that JRRT created he is my favorite. The other characters all seem perferct in some way I can't explain. Boromir however, he was human, he had flaws and in his flaws (or at least the way Sean Bean portrayed him on screen) his flaws made him real. Maybe I see my own flaws in him. We'd all like to think we had the resolve of Aragorn, the perfect aim of Legolas, the kindness of Frodo. Maybe it's not only important how we live but how we die as well that marks us as the kind of person we will be remembered as. Maybe it's ok to be human. 

I have heard that many of the cannon police eschew the idea that elves have emotions. Or not perhaps that they have them but that they hide them under cooly unruffled exteriors and they NEVER EVER EVER show worry or fear. My elves both show AND have emotions. My Thranduil loves his sons, in each of them he sees something of the legacy he will leave behind should he either die or sail to Valinor. Although where Erim is concerned Thranduil has on more than one occasion thought of sending him on to Valinor now as Erim sometimes shows a marked lack of emotional maturity, Soren (stop giggling Olie, lol) wrestles with his own self doubt, how can he lead a people when after all these millenia he still has been unable to deal with the emotional scars left to him by Nathair (which means "snake" in Scottish) 

OK, I've been worrying this last thing I am going to talk about in today's entry for a few days since I started looking thinking about Brotherhood again. I've also sat here, putting this off for as long as I could. Not yet ready to hit enter and save this, but not ready to type it out as well. I've watched music video's, surfed the web, checked to see who is online (several times) What if I changed this story from the beginning in that Legolas' rape was a known fact, at least to his family and the rangers who found him? 

Now here is where the cannon police are screaming at the top of their lungs for everyone knows that raped elves fade. However and I need to go find this so I can quote some chapters and verse, it is ONLY bonded elves that fade when raped. Which is why Legolas did not die when he was so brutally violated. Hoever Legolas does not realize this for he too assumed that all raped elves faded, which is why he thinks he must have invited the attack upon himself. Which is a common thing that rape victims in real life feel "I must have done something to deserve this". Soren too is feeling this, but with him, it has caused him to question his sexuality and it's another reason why he has chosen to remain mateless. Is he really attracted to men? Otherwise why would Nathair have chosen to spend time with him? Was he leading him on? Many of these same questions Legolas will be asking himself. And Soren will come to be jealous of Legolas for Legolas will start to deal with these things, that Soren still cannot. 

I am tired now, it's time to take my sleepy pill and consign myself into that lovely abyss of rest. Each new days brings new thoughts I am closer to my story, it will be told, only now I believe it as well.

Thank you Mike.

Thank you Olie.</lj_cut>

This entry is dedicated to Olie who is NOT the cannon police, lol. 

<lj-cut text = "I have always been jealous of Mike and Olie"> I have always been jealous, in a loving way of course, lol. Of Mike's (Ignoblebard) writing ablility. I am jealous of Olie's (liz/jael)writing ablilty (in same loving way, lol) as well. I don't even know where I am going on this life journey (here I am 41, divorced and working as a convenience store clerk) I always wonder how can I tell a story and know how it ends when I don't even know how my own life story will end. To which I am sure both Mike and Olie would say "it's the journey not the destination."

I'm 41 and I'm wearing bifocals, they make me sick to my stomach and I wonder if it's ever going to get better? I used to know so many things and now I feel like I don't know anything at all. Mike can write a sex scene that makes you forget to blink while you are reading it. Olie can write a scene between Thanduil and Legolas that puts you so in the moment you look up from reading expecing to find yourself surrounded by the stone of Mirkwood Keep. Mike can write a story about Legolas and Mandos that now, over two years later still reads as flawless as it did when it was finally finished. Olie can write a story about elves and Hamlet that leaves you howling in the floor with laughter. 

BUT what I am most envious of is that both Mike and Olie can start a story and then finish that story. Which I have yet to be able to do with Brotherhood. However, as I sit here and think on what I just wrote, perhaps the true ending to Brotherhood is that there is no ending. Just because I type THE END, doesn't mean happily ever after. Legolas will go on dealing with his rape one way or another for the rest of his life. Just as Soren will be dealing with being molested by his fathers most trusted advisor and all the issues that go along with that for the rest of his days as well. 

I have a two fold problem with Brotherhood and getting it completed otherwise. One of which is I never really thought out what the Brotherhood was other than dead human male spirits who's life essence had been crushed out of them by the same man. I had loosely based this man on John Wayne Gacy who had used and then discarded over 30 boys/young men in their teens to early 20's, raping them savagely then killing most of them once he deemed them used up. A scant few of them (less than the number of fingers on one hand) he allowed to live, certain that even should they go to the police, his word would be taken over theirs for he was a successful business man while they were "street kids". But as Mike pointed out, that many missing boys, even in a place such as ME would be noticed, so I had origionally gone with it was just boys who had been killed over a period of years by different people. But that would not cause them to band together as it would should they all have been killed by the same man. I want to keep Estel in this story, even though I have him here, many years before his actual birth. But in that case, I needed a character that was already recognizable and one whose motives would not be questioned as they might if I had an original character. I do know the cannon police frown in this, "everything in it's place" they archly say. "Bollocks", I reply. But as I sit here staring at my journal, thoughts milling about in my head. I could have Estel hunting this man. And I do believe it's very feasible for him to elude capture for some time. Gacy had an animal cunning about him, (his crime spree running for many years) it was only when he got sloppy and stuid at the end was he caught. Though I do not have a book here to confirm what I next say, I do know Aragorn hunted Gollum for I think at least 2 years before he finally laid hands on him. So there is some precedent even though the cannon police are likely to add this to their fodder of nitter nattering.  Another thought about the Brotherhood too, their bodies have never been found, which is why they are angry they have been denied a proper burial. If I recall my ghost lore correctly the spirit could come back restless and unhappy because it has no final home. </lj-cut>

<lj-cut text = "This is the second time">This is the second time I have tried to get this journal entry written, I deleted the first one by mistake ARGH!!!! This is more of just me working out my thoughts about a story I have written and can't seem to finish and I talked about that in my earlier journal entry. One of my main chacters is called Soren (quit giggling Olie, mike told me, lol) Though the cannon police beg to differ, JRRT never really said one way or the other if Legolas was an only child. So for the purpose of my story and to give me some contrasting viewpoints I created 3 other brothers for Legolas. Soren is the oldest and the one closest to my heart and the loudest one in my head and I'll go more into detal about him in a minute. Erim is the next brother, he represents the faction of people who don't get rape and who can't understand why the person is "not over it yet", after all "that was months ago now". Azezin is the youngest, he is still sunny and child like. He reprents the innocence that once lost can never be reclaimed. 

Soren is tall, broad across the shoulders and chest, lean and tapered down to his waist. He's a warrior like his father, with long more golden colored hair where Legolas would be wheat colored. He has scars on his body both from training and battle. You can't be safe and be a warrior. He loves and fears his father equally. But beyond the father son thing he knows he is next in line to the throne and this weighs heavily on his shoulders. He is the dutiful responsible first born son. He is a true leader and he has the respect of those who serve under him. In all these millienia he has never taken a mate. Many think he has a secret lover somewhere and he has never disabused anyone of that notion because the realty is Soren is still a virgin. He was molested by one of his father's most trusted advisors when he was just out of his majority but still an elfing by many standards. His father found out about it, sent the advisor away, later the advisor died a hero in battle. His father never addressed what happened to Soren. So Soren was left to sort it out on his own, which he did as best he could just by burying it. He was a king's son and he had higher duties than to his own personal needs. So Soren put it out of his mind and never addressed it again. He never sought out a mate because of his guilt over the death of the adviosor and the belief somehow that this is all his fault that he did something to make the advisor think he wanted that kind of attention. He is not unaware of what goes on between consenting adults, he just wants no part of it after what happened. I do think he masturbates (Soren gets very quiet and turns his back to me when I ask) but finally admits it's almost a guilt thing when he does, it's a hurried thing he wants it over as quickly as possible. Time has passed and for the most part he has completely buried those memories. From time to time they tend to trot themselves out in his reviere when he is highly stressed but other than that he has dealt with it to the best of his ability and indeed he has not thought about being molested for several centuries now. And it could have gone on forever like that had Legolas not been raped. Now (though he hides it very well) Soren emotions are all tangled up again. Thranduil seems more concerned over Legolas rape than he ever was over Soren being molested and Soren finds himself resenting Legolas (and more than a wee bit pissed off at his father as well) about this. But he loves Legolas and wants to help him but he can't do that without addresssing his own abuse him when he was younger and this means dredging up old memories he would far prefer to leave buried. Soren would love to cry but there is no one he trusts enough to drop his emotional barriors around and allow them to see that side of himself. 

Another reason why I need Soren in my story is because again I am dealing with real men (elves) who have real emotions. I need someone there who understands, but not perfectly, what Legolas went through and to write a story where two brothers had been brutally raped even by fictional stories is pushing the limits of believablity. They did not have counselors in ME back then. So I have to have someone who has been there in some fashion, someone who is close to Legolas. A servant would be out of the question, again bit too convenient to have a female rape victim (or so I think) so I have to have a male. 

Well it's time to close down and start restocking my beer cooler. Soren has gotten quiet, I expect he's off somewhere thinking at the moment. When I next write I plan to talk about Torin, Calum and the supernatural element to this story.<lj-cut>

<lj-cut text = "I have put this off for too long">I have put this off for too long. I have a story, I started it a few years ago, my best friend Mike is after me to finish it but I honestly don't know if I ever will. I have 19 chapters written and I've taken them all down save the first chapter. Mike says that a lot of readers might be turned off and not want to read anymore simply because of how brutal it is. But rape is brutal and so many people write it like it's a hot sexy thing that in the end it turns out the person who was raped really wanted that after all. But in my story there is no doubt this was an unwanted intrusion into the life of its victim and if someone does not want to read it for that reason they are welcome to go elsewhere. 

The story begins with Legolas being raped and like a stone thrown in a pond, the repercussions ripple out from there. Mike says one of the things that makes the story more interesting than your usual run of the mill rape story is the supernatual element I have added in. By means of a dead human boy named Calum. The cannon police would just have kitties over that for everyone knows that elves cannot see ghosts the way humans can. I couldn't make Calum a elf because elf's also don't become ghosts.

But I wanted Calum to be a human, to represent that part of Legolas that he can never recapture because he has been a victim of rape. Calum, his living older brother Torin and Soren, Legolas older brother. I chose all those names for a reason, Calum means "dove" in Celtic. To me the dove is about innosense. Sculptures of doves are also sometimes placed on the gravestones of children. Torin is "chief" in Irish. A chief takes care of their people, yet the irony is that Torin was never able to protect his little brother from the man who killed him and he provides the dichotomy of should have or could have that we all wrestle with, when something bad happens to someone we love. Soren means "God of Thunder" in Danish. Which I find myself thinking of also as the hand of righteouness, one who sees that justice is done for those who can no longer seek justice for themselves and where I get that from I have no idea.

And all I know is this simple story has become confused and now I am no longer sure of what my original intent had been when I started this story oh so long ago now. Soren keeps trying to take over. So take him out of the mix, somone who stumbles across this journal entry might say? Not so easy, I reply. The other problem with this story is writing male characters that act like real men and/or elves. Sure it would be easy to have Legolas a crying bundle of misery all over the place. But reality dictates that most men do not act that way. Legolas is also the son of a King, so he would have been taught from a very early age to keep his emotions in check. So I had to have a male character who had (to some degree) been where Legolas is now and who would understand what he was feeling. Which is where Soren came in, Many years previous to Legolas' birth Soren was molested by a trusted member of the family. So he understands to some degree how his brother feels and can give him the support he needs. However, as Soren has pointed out to me on more than one occasion, he is still very angry over being molested, He thought he had dealt with it but his father has reacted much different to Legolas being raped than he has with Soren being molested. This has left Soren, somewhat resentful of Legolas and angry at his father as well. But Soren is very much his fathers son, in looks as well as temperment and it will be some time before he finally explodes. But Soren also genuinly loves Legolas and he wants to help him. He also thinks that by helping Legolas to talk about and/or open up about what happened that he (Soren) will find a way to finally deal with his anger over being molested so long ago. 

I don't know how to use the $#@*(& spell check for this and I know there are several words mispelled, Mike will tell me how to do this next time I talk to him, I am sure, lol.

It is time for bed so TBC.....</lj-cut/

What LoTR Character Are You?
You are most like Gimli. Most people think you're pretty rough, but you're actually rather sophisticated. Unlike others, you don't need everything to be perfect. You're flexible. When problems come your way, you face them head-on and get whatever help you need. You also stick to your morals very closely, and you are unlikely to compromise. You are very loyal to your friends, but don't be so controlling! I took a LoTR personality quiz and I have to laugh the above results are just like me!! Now I just need my own Legolas, sigh.
Hello everyone, this is me, more later.
